author: Peter Blumberg
description: Embattled Salvadoran immigrant Kilmar Abrego Garcia asked a Tennessee court to let him return to his home state of Maryland as a free man, while also accusing the US Justice Department of vindictive prosecution.
title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia Seeks Release, Alleges Vindictive Prosecution By Trump’s DOJ

author: Alicia A. Caldwell
description: President Donald Trump has ordered the entire southern border wall to be painted black to stop migrants from crossing because it’ll be too hot to touch, according to Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem.
title: Trump Wants to Paint Border Wall Black So It’s Too Hot to Touch

author: Justin Sink
description: The White House launched its own TikTok account on Tuesday, the latest signal of support as President Donald Trump continues to seek a sale of the social video app’s US operations from Chinese company ByteDance Ltd.
title: White House Launches TikTok Account With US Sale Uncertain

author: Gerson Freitas Jr, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The US government proposed a major increase in biofuels mandates earlier this year that would benefit farmers at the expense of oil refiners. Now the Trump administration is set to issue a second policy decision that could again shake up the renewable fuels market.
title: EPA Is Close to Key Decision on Biofuel Waivers for Oil Refiners

author: Annie Massa
description: President Donald Trump’s Miami area golf course will host the PGA Tour in 2026, the first time in about a decade that the league will hold an event at a Trump property.
title: Trump Doral to Host PGA Tour in 2026, Ending Decade of Distance

author: Dylan Sloan
description: A week after Eric Trump and Donald Trump Jr. rang the Nasdaq opening bell for a $1.5 billion deal involving biotech-turned-crypto payments company Alt5 Sigma Corp. and Trump-backed crypto firm World Liberty Financial, blue-chip hedge funds are getting in on the action.
title: Point72, ExodusPoint Bought Stakes in Trump-Tied Crypto Firm

author: Ken Parks
description: Uruguay’s central bank extended its easing cycle by lowering the key interest rate a quarter point following two months of inflation near its target.
title: Uruguay Cuts Benchmark Rate to 8.75% With Inflation on Target

author: Joe Deaux
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economic statecraft reporter Joe Deaux looks at President Trump’s willingness to insert the government in corporate matters. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Brand of Statecraft Draws Government, Companies Closer

author: Edward Bolingbroke
description: Traders are piling into one specific options wager that relies on a dovish Federal Reserve slashing interest rates by over a quarter-point next month.
title: Wager for Half-Point Rate Reduction Faces Test of Powell Remarks

author: Marcelo Rochabrun
description: Peru is notorious for prosecuting and incarcerating former presidents. The country’s top court has now severely restricted conducting those criminal probes while a head of state is still in office.
title: Peru’s Top Court Halts All Criminal Probes Against President Boluarte

author: Matt Day
description: Microsoft Corp. employees have started setting up a protest encampment at the company’s Redmond, Washington, headquarters, ratcheting up a campaign calling for company to stop doing business with Israel over its war in Gaza.
title: Microsoft Workers Protesting Israel Ties Occupy HQ Campus

author: Alex Wickham, Catherine Lucey
description: US President Donald Trump called Viktor Orban on Monday following talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy and European leaders to discuss why the Hungarian prime minister was blocking Ukraine’s accession talks with the European Union, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: After Putin Call, Trump Rang Orban Over Ukraine EU Membership

author: Joe Lovinger
description: Generations of Texas politicians have sat, voted and debated in the cushioned leather chairs on the floor of the state’s House of Representatives, but few have spent the night in one — let alone with a bonnet and eye mask.
title: Texas Democrats Are Being Tracked by Police to Block Repeat Exit

author: Laura Nahmias, Amanda L Gordon
description: Philanthropist Elizabeth Simons, the daughter of Renaissance Technologies founder James Simons, gave $250,000 to a super PAC supporting Democratic mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani last week.
title: Hedge Fund Heir Elizabeth Simons Gives $250,000 to Mamdani PAC

author: Ellen Milligan, Andrea Palasciano, Milda Seputyte
description: A package of security guarantees for Ukraine will take shape as soon as this week as leaders seize on President Donald Trump’s backing for a plan that involves sending European troops as part of a potential peace deal.
title: Europe Races to Leverage Trump’s Support for Ukraine Troop Plan

author: Levin Stamm
description: Switzerland would grant Russian President Vladimir Putin immunity from arrest as part of a proposal to host peace talks on the war in Ukraine.
title: Switzerland Ready to Offer Putin Immunity as Part of Peace Talks

author: Eltaf Najafizada
description: The Afghan Taliban will host a trilateral meeting with China and Pakistan in Kabul on Wednesday — the first such high-level gathering since it regained power four years ago — in a bid to bolster its push for international legitimacy.
title: Taliban to Host First Trilateral Talks With China, Pakistan

author: Antonia Mufarech
description: Chile center-right presidential candidate Evelyn Matthei said she’ll aim to create one million new jobs, according to a government program released Tuesday as her campaign struggles to regain traction.
title: Chile Presidential Candidate Matthei Vows One Million New Jobs

author: Galit Altstein
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s cabinet approved an increase to this year’s state budget to cover additional spending incurred by the 12-day war with Iran in June and ongoing fighting in Gaza.
title: Israel Approves Increase to Budget to Cover Ongoing Costs of War

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: Democratic Republic of Congo’s army accused Rwanda-backed M23 rebels of attacking its positions in the east of the country and threatening peace talks overseen by the US and Qatari governments.
title: Congo Says M23 Rebel Attacks Threaten Qatari Peace Talks

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The Trump administration said it will step up scrutiny of imports of steel, copper, lithium and other materials from China to enforce a US ban on goods allegedly made with forced labor in the country’s Xinjiang region.
title: US Targets Chinese Steel And Lithium for Forced-Labor Scrutiny

author: Chiranjivi Chakraborty
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent claimed some of the “richest families in India” benefited from the purchase of Russian crude oil, while reiterating plans to boost tariffs on the South Asian nation.
title: Bessent Says India’s Richest Families Benefit From Russia Deals

author: Eliyahu Kamisher, Biz Carson
description: Governor Gavin Newsom has rallied enough support from local Democratic leaders to plow ahead with a controversial initiative to redraw California’s congressional maps. A key next task: tapping the state’s wealthy to help sell the plan to voters.
title: Newsom Woos California Billionaires in Map Fight Against Trump

author: Brian Platt
description: Canadian artificial intelligence firm Cohere Inc. has signed a non-binding agreement with Prime Minister Mark Carney’s government to potentially expand the use of the technology in the public sector.
title: Cohere Signs Agreement with Canadian Government on Expanding AI

author: Min-Jeong Lee
description: Less than two weeks after President Donald Trump called for the ouster of Intel Corp.’s Lip-Bu Tan, the company’s chief executive officer has a shot at securing billions of dollars in fresh capital that could help him turn around the troubled US chipmaker.
title: Intel’s CEO Draws Support for Revival From SoftBank, Trump

author: Josh Wingrove
description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick confirmed discussions between the US and Intel Corp. for the government to take a stake in the chipmaker, casting the plan as a bid to convert Chips and Science Act grants into equity.
title: US Seeks Intel Stake Without Governance Rights, Lutnick Says

author: Joe Deaux
description: He didn’t campaign on it. It wasn’t even broached during his first administration. He criticized his predecessor for it.
title: Trump Targets Corporate America to Achieve Economic and Foreign Policy Goals

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Donald Trump urged Russia’s Vladimir Putin and Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskiy to show some “flexibility” as the US president accelerates his efforts to end the war in Ukraine.
title: Trump Says Putin, Zelenskiy Must Show Flexibility, Pushes Summit

author: Michael Smith
description: In immigrant-heavy Miami, a Cuban-born businessman and Catholic leader are leading a backlash to ICE sweeps.
title: Trump-Loathing Billionaire Teams With Archbishop to Fight Deportations

author: Ani Avetisyan
description: Armenia’s premier welcomed Iran’s response to a US-brokered peace declaration with Azerbaijan, pledging to broaden economic ties with the Persian Gulf nation.
title: Armenia Hails Iran Ties After US-Backed Peace Declaration With Azerbaijan

author: Isolde MacDonogh
description: European defense stocks tumbled on Tuesday as Donald Trump’s renewed push for peace in Ukraine and an agreement by Hamas to a truce deal in Gaza put the brakes on their powerful rally.
title: European Defense Stocks Slide on Push for Peace in Ukraine, Gaza

author: Patrick Sykes
description: The deeper the IRGC’s entrenchment, the harder it will be for the US and Israel to dislodge.
title: Iran’s Revolutionary Guard Defies US and Israel

author: Anisah Shukry
description: Malaysia is considering the need for laws to address bullying after public outcry over the unsolved death of a 13-year-old schoolgirl in Sabah sparked demands for justice, ahead of an election in the Borneo state.
title: Malaysia Weighs Anti-Bullying Law After Outcry Over Teen’s Death

author: Daniel Basteiro, Anna Edwards, Guy Johnson
description: Spain’s top diplomat dismissed a suggestion that the nation’s failure to commit to a revised NATO spending target was the reason for its absence from this week’s talks to discuss Russia’s war on Ukraine.
title: Spain Says NATO Spat Didn’t Prompt Exclusion From Ukraine Talks

author: Andrea Jaramillo
description: Desperate patients struggle to afford basic care and medicines as Petro pushes for a bigger state role in the Andean nation’s once-robust medical system.
title: Health Crisis Spirals in Colombia as ERs and Maternity Wards Close

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The Pentagon plans to spend more than $3.5 billion to replenish inventories in the wake of recurring Israel operations, underscoring the costs of maintaining a stepped-up presence in the Middle East.
title: Pentagon Eyes $3.5 Billion Restock Costs From Israel Operations

author: Alberto Nardelli, Alex Wickham
description: US and European officials will immediately work on providing Ukraine with robust security guarantees to open a path for a landmark meeting between presidents Vladimir Putin and Volodymyr Zelenskiy, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US and Europe to Work Immediately on Ukraine Security Guarantees

author: Lucy White
description: More than half of UK millionaires in a survey signaled they’d be more likely to leave the country if the Labour government introduces a new wealth tax.
title: UK Wealth Tax Would Spur Millionaire Exits to US, Survey Says

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s top aide said ties with Beijing are on an “upward trend,” another signal that New Delhi may be recalibrating its foreign policy amid mounting tariff pressure from US President Donald Trump.
title: India Sees ‘Upward Trend’ in China Ties Amid Trump Threats

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thai Princess Bajrakitiyabha Narendira Debyavati is being treated for low blood pressure and a severe infection in the bloodstream, the Bureau of the Royal Household said.
title: Thai Princess Being Treated for Low Blood Pressure, Palace Says

author: K Oanh Ha
description: Visitors to the US arriving on student visas plunged in July, falling year-on-year for a fourth straight month.
title: Student Arrivals to US Continue to Plummet, With Asia Hit Especially Hard

author: Robert Brand
description: The African Union has thrown its weight behind a campaign to adopt a world map that more accurately reflects the continent’s relative size than the one currently adorning most geography-class walls.
title: African Union Back Campaign to Adopt More Realistic World Map

author: Grace Sihombing, Prima Wirayani
description: Indonesia risks blowing past its budget deficit target for next year, according to analysts, citing President Prabowo Subianto’s populist spending promises and no plans for new tax measures.
title: Prabowo’s Populist Budget Raises Doubts Over Revenue Goals

author: Brian Platt
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney’s chief rival, Conservative Party Leader Pierre Poilievre, has regained a parliamentary seat after cruising to an easy victory in a special election Monday night.
title: Carney’s Chief Rival to Return to Parliament After Winning New Seat

author: Katarina Hoije
description: As an International Monetary Fund mission arrives in Senegal this week, investors are watching to see if the West African nation will inch closer to securing new funding to stabilize its strained public finances.
title: IMF Visit to Senegal in Spotlight for Clues on Vital New Program

author: Natalia Drozdiak, Josh Wingrove
description: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskiy made sure to be on his best behavior for a crucial Oval Office meeting with Donald Trump — and it paid off.
title: Zelenskiy and His Allies Turn on Charm to Keep Trump’s Favor

author: Golnar Motevalli
description: The 12 day conflict in June was the most damaging in the IRGC’s history, yet the organization is now more critical to the survival of the Islamic Republic.
title: Iran’s Military Elite Emerges From War Bruised and Emboldened

author: Jose Orozco
description: The US will send three Aegis guided-missile destroyers to waters off Venezuela in the next 36 hours to address what Washington sees as the threat from drug cartels, Reuters reported, citing two people with knowledge of the matter.
title: US Sends Warships Toward Venezuela to Combat Drug Threats, Reuters Says

description: Sir Keir Starmer has hailed "real progress" made during a White House summit with European leaders aimed at bringing an end to the war in Ukraine.
title: Starmer Hails 'Real Progress' Made During White House Summit on Ukraine War

author: Katia Dmitrieva
description: President Donald Trump’s tariff war is accelerating Beijing’s trade and investment push into developing nations known as the Global South, according to research by S&P Global, potentially creating a new trade order dominated by Chinese firms.
title: Trump Tariffs Seen Fostering New China-Global South Trade Order

author: Ruth Carson
description: President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs have roiled markets, unnerved trade partners and provoked criticism from leading economists. But there is an upside: The levies will help the US maintain its fiscal health, according to S&P Global Ratings.
title: Trump Tariffs Get Seal of Approval as S&P Affirms Credit Rating

author: Antonia Mufarech
description: Chile’s communist candidate Jeannette Jara pledged to gradually raise the minimum wage and increase lithium production in a government program released Monday, a step back from the more radical proposals she unveiled earlier this year.
title: Chile’s Communist Candidate Tones Down Proposals as Race Starts

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un called for the “rapid expansion” of his country’s nuclear weapons program, escalating tensions with the US and South Korea as the allies conduct joint military drills that Pyongyang views as a prelude to war.
title: North Korea Urges Rapid Nuclear Weapons Growth After US Drills

author: Martha Viotti Beck
description: Brazil is forcefully rejecting Washington’s allegations of unfair trade practices, describing an investigation launched by the US Trade Representative into the matter as an illegitimate use of unilateral US trade law.
title: Brazil Pushes Back Against US Probe Into Its Trade Practices
